Item.Title: Ty Am Ddim
Item.Genre: IP Ffeithiol/Adloniant Cyffredinol - Factual/Gen Ent Factual Entertainment
Item.Synopsis:
Houses Series
Two contributors from Gwynedd strive to make a profit this week. Former soldier (Jamie) and a mother from Blaenau Ffestiniog (Laura). It's an emotional auction as the family who owned the house in the past find out who the new buyers are. They, unfortunately, could't afford to keep the property in the family.
Laura and Jamie's partnership faces many challenges with both working separately for most of the renovation period. The financial strain also becomes clear as quotes start to roll in from various contractors. Laura is determined to try and generate 10k profit each - but both ultimately pay the price for going over their original budget and make a really disappointing profit.
Item.Commercial_Refs: Viewer wearing Abercrombie and Fitch T shirt in part 4
Item.Billing: We head for Anglesey this time to buy the next house of the series. Two young people from Gwynedd will be crossing fingers that the task of refurbishing a house will help them in turn to afford a house of their own. But are they willing to work for their money?

This a series based on three garages in West Wales - Derwen Garage,Harford, BV Rees, Llandudoch and Gwili Jones,Lampeter. These are the legends that buy and sell, test and repair cars to keep the nation on the road.

Item.Title: Cwymp Yr Ymerodraethau

Item.Synopsis: Hywel Williams looks at events in the downfall of the forgotten Dutch empire, Amongst these moments are: â¢1667's Dutch naval raid on Britain. This attack gave desire for British revenge and rivalry with the Dutch, This contributed, through trade competition and falling profits in the VOC (Dutch East India Company), being declared bankrupt in 1799, the collapse of the richest private company the world had yet seen. â¢25th August 1830, the opera performance of La Meutte de Portici - led to riots, and catholic Belgium declaring independence from protestant Netherlands on 4th October 1830. â¢1942 - Japanese troops land across the Dutch East Indies, resulting in Sukarno's rise to power and Indonesia breaking free of Dutch rule at the end of the war.
Item.Billing: Historian Hywel Williams looks at events in the downfall of the forgotten Dutch Empire.

There is a family theme going on in tonight's programme as Ifan welcomes his big brother, the tenor Robyn Lyn Evans and his wife Aneira to perform on the show along with the middle brother in the Evans family, Dewi Sion, who sings a well-known and very popular duet with his friend Barry Powell. Sian James, Meinir Gwilym, Gwyneth Glyn and Gwenan Gibbard are well known faces as soloists on the Noson Lawen, but tonight they morph as the new group 'Pedair'. With a successful career in musical theatre, Sam Ebenezer returns home from London to perform and the Welsh Whisperer delights the audience with his quirky performance. Musician Rhys Taylor, local talent Steffan Rees and students from Pantycelyn fill the stage and the theatre with stunning performances.

Item.Synopsis: Magic and Cardiff will be on the bill as Huw Stephens watches films from The National Library of Wales' Screen and Sound Archive. Studio guest, animator Huw Aaron, will be delighted with a pioneering film by Welsh cartoonist Sid Griffiths, animated adverts from a Port Talbot cinema, and at the mix of music and magic in a film from Blaenau Ffestiniog. Archive footage of Cardiff is on the bill for Hanna Jarman, with clips featuring Shirley Bassey and Fred Keenor , the opening of Cardiff's first purpose built mosque, Tiger Bay's Rainbow Club, as well as a heartwarming film about Roath Park and the story of three American G.I.'s, who lived in Whitchurch.
Item.Billing: Magic and animation will be on the bill as Huw Stephens watches films from The National Library of Wales' Screen and Sound Archive. Studio guest, animator Huw Aaron, will be delighted with a pioneering film by Welsh cartoonist Sid Griffiths, animated adverts from a Port Talbot cinema, and at the mix of music and magic in a film from Blaenau Ffestiniog. Archive footage of Cardiff is on the bill for Hanna Jarman, with clips featuring Shirley Bassey and Fred Keenor , the opening of Cardiff's first purpose built mosque, Tiger Bay's Rainbow Club, as well as a heartwarming film about Roath Park and the story of three American G.I.'s, who lived in Whitchurch.

Item.Title: Cerys Matthews a'r Goeden Faled
Item.Genre: IP Ffeithiol/Adloniant Cyffredinol - Factual/Gen Ent Factual Entertainment
Item.Synopsis: Y Goeden Faled is a brand new series looking at the history of some of the most popular folk songs in Wales. Each week we'll follow singer, Cerys Matthews, on a quest to find the roots of the songs. Who wrote the words? Where does the melody come from? The story behind the songs will take us across Wales and beyond and will uncover surprises along the way! In the first episode, Cerys will travel to Parc y Scarlets to discover more about one of our most well-known songs: Sosban Fach. But does the song originate from Llanelli? Cerys will also look at the history of Moliannwn; a story which will take us from Bethesda to the slate mines of America and back. Cerys will also be performing each song in her own unique style.
Item.Billing: A 2014 series looking at the history of some of the most popular folk songs in Wales. Each week we'll follow singer Cerys Matthews on a quest to trace the roots of the songs. In today's programme, Cerys will discover more about the folk songs Sosban Fach and Moliannwn we'll hear her perform each song in her own, unique style.

Item.Title: Trefi Gwyllt Iolo
Item.Genre: IP Ffeithiol/Adloniant Cyffredinol - Factual/Gen Ent Serious Factual
Item.Billing: In the last in the series, Iolo Williams looks for town wildlife all over Wales. In a Pontypool garage he comes across a false widow spider which can sometimes give a nasty bite. Mice have made a home in a garage in Colwyn Bay and a hedgehog visits a garden for his nightly supper in Deri in the Darran Valley. Also in the programme, he sees birds making use of roof tops in Blaenau Ffestiniog, Aberystwyth and Llanrwst.

Item.Title: Eryri: Croeso NÃ´l?
Item.Genre: IP Ffeithiol/Adloniant Cyffredinol - Factual/Gen Ent Factual Entertainment
Item.Synopsis: Tourism in a contentious subject in Snowdonia and between March and October 2020 tensions came to a head as Covid -19 and the lock down took its toll on everyone. The tourism industry shrank and everything came to a halt, before re-opening for the busiest summer ever. The programme will follow some of the National Park's wardens as well as a cross section of the people who live and work in Snowdonia, during one of the most unusual summers in the area's history. People will question themselves on what the future will bring to Eryri's communities and what kind of tourism they would like to see in the future?

Item.Synopsis: For generations Ystwyth Fets in Aberystwyth have been caring for the animals of Ceredigion. Ziggy the cat needs urgent cancer treatment. A terrier is rushed to the practice having been run over by a car. There's no wonder that a husky has a painful tummy as she has only ever eaten takeaway food! And Glesni has to rush into theatre to perform surgery on Ted the dog.

Item.Title: Hafod Haul
Item.Synopsis: The ducks at Hafod Haul farm are a happy lot, enjoying life on the lake. Ben is also usually a very happy duck, friends with everyone, and always in the know with what's going on at the farm. However, today, Ben is feeling quite sad, and thinks that he has no talent like the other animals. Pedol is a big strong horse, able to carry Heti on his back when they go riding; Jaff can run swiftly after the sheep; and the hens lay fresh eggs every day. Despite their reassurances, none of the animals manage to cheer up Ben, and he is feeling quite low and useless when he returns to the lake. Later that day, whilst feeding the ducks, Heti loses her favourite bracelet in the water. No one else can help her find it, but Ben dives into the water and recovers the missing bracelet. Ben has a special talent after all, and Heti is so grateful to him.
Item.Billing: Ben is feeling sad that he has no special talent. But when no one else can help Heti find her favourite bracelet, Ben dives deep into the water and recovers it.

Item.Billing: This lovely animated series offers an opportunity to sing traditional and contemporary songs and rhymes while learning about animals, gestures, counting and the weather. Item.Title: Sam TÃ¢n
Item.Synopsis: Norman wakes up one morning to find that the whole of Pontypandy is flooded! Fireman Sam is up with Tom Thomas in his helicopter surveying the extent of the flood. The Jones family are stranded on the Wholefish CafÃ© roof. Sam straps himself in the harness and lowers himself down from the helicopter to rescue them. Bronwyn is worried as Lion is missing and Charlie cannot find his boat. Meanwhile in Norman's room, Norman is worrying about Woolley and Lambikins. Dilys tries to comfort him but it doesn't soothe Norman's anxiety. After Dilys has given Norman his breakfast Norman decides to go out and rescue them. He finds the skiff floating outside of his window and he makes his escape. On his search for Woolley and Lambikins he finds Lion floating in a dustbin lid. Norman rescues him and carries on searching. Penny and Elvis are in Neptune rescuing the people of Pontypandy from their flooded homes. They rescue Trevor from his bus and go on to find Dilys and Norman. When they find her she is in a panic as Norman is missing. She goes with Penny and Elvis to find him while Trevor offers to stay at the shop to see if he comes back. Norman finds Woolley and Lambikins in the flooded fields. He rescues them in his boat but they are too restless and tip Norman out of the boat and he can't swim! Boy overboard! Luckily Sam and Tom spot him in the helicopter and alert Penny in Neptune. Penny, Dilys and Elvis arrive to rescue Norman just in time. They take Norman, Woolley, Lambikins and Lion back safely to the Fire station where they are reunited with everyone safe and sound.
Item.Billing: Pontypandy is flooded and the fire crew are busy saving the residents.

Item.Title: Hafod Haul
Item.Synopsis: The animals are all worried at Hafod Haul farm today. Jaff has overheard Heti on the phone saying that somebody must leave the farm. But who? Who has made Heti so cross that she would want them to leave? In their turn all the animals give their reasons why everything points at them . Cled the cockerel remembers when he crowed so loudly by Heti's bed when she slept late one morning, that she fell out of bed in fright! Cadi and Caio the little horses remember the time they went into the house and broke a plate in the kitchen, and also painted themselves as zebras. Pedol, reminds us that he once made Heti cross when he ate the flowers from the garden; Ben the duck took a bath in the bathroom; and the pigs stole Heti's sheets from the washing line and played ghosts! And what about Gwen the goat? She is convinced that she may be the one who will be sent to the moon because she once borrowed Heti's best hat, and went for a walk to the village pub. In time, after much worrying they find out that Pws the cat is the one who has to leave - for the simple reason that she can go to see the vet because of a bad leg. Everybody is very relieved that no-one has to be sent away to live on the moon after all.
Item.Billing: Jaff has overheard Heti on the telephone saying someone must leave the farm today, and all the animals arel worried it could be them.

They are: Hari the hipo; Ela the fox and Seren the bat and they're the most curious, adventurous and funniest pop up animals that any book could possibly have. Once the book is opened the Abadas' world comes alive, and it's playtime for the three adventurers. Their favourite game? It's their very own Abadas word game. Join the Abadas as they try and match a new word with objects found on the Abada Island and have an "aba-doo-be-dee" time in the process!
Item.Billing: The Abadas are cantering around the island playing 'horsey'. As their play comes to an end, Ben has another great game for them; 'the word game'. Today's new word has something to do with horses too, what could it be ?

Item.Title: Cymoedd Roy Noble
Item.Genre: IP Ffeithiol/Adloniant Cyffredinol - Factual/Gen Ent Factual Entertainment
Item.Synopsis: Roy returns to Amman valley where he grew up as a child and begins at The Ganolfa, Brynaman which was his former junior school and reminisces with Glynog Davies a former pupil. Brynaman cinema is still going strong and that's thanks to Brian Harries who has given 50years service to the place. Tairgwaith trotting ground is the next stop where he meets Eric Jones and Huw Thomas which gives him an insight into to the trotting racing world. Roy also meets Elizabeth Huw's daughter who follows her father's footsteps within the horse competing world. Finally last stop is Corgi the woolens manufacturers based in Ammanford who are leading the way within the fashion industry worldwide.
Item.Commercial_Refs: Corgi Hosiery Ltd Burberry Selfridges Harrods
Item.Billing: This time, Roy returns to Amman Valley where he grew up and begins at Y Ganolfan, Brynamman which was his former junior school and reminisces with Glynog Davies a former pupil. Brynamman cinema is still going strong and that's thanks to Brian Harries who has given 50 years' service to the establishment. Tairgwaith Trotting Ground is the next stop where Roy meets Eric Jones and Huw Thomas. The last stop is Corgi in Ammanford, a hosiery and knitwear company.

Item.Title: Cerys Matthews a'r Goeden Faled
Item.Genre: IP Ffeithiol/Adloniant Cyffredinol - Factual/Gen Ent Factual Entertainment
Item.Synopsis: In the second episode of Y Goeden Faled, Cerys Matthews continues her journey to discover the roots of some of Wales' most well-known folk songs. Who was Dafydd y Garreg Wen ('David of The White Rock')? Cerys travels to Borth-y-Gest in search of the famous white rock and to find out why the song became popular throughout Wales and beyond. Cerys also visits the Eglwyswrw area to learn more about the characters and locations in the song, Y Mochyn Du, and looks at the history of the harp in Wales in the company of Llio Rhydderch and Gwenan Gibbard.
Item.Billing: Cerys Matthews continues her journey to discover the roots of some of Wales's most well-known folk songs - Dafydd y Garreg Wen ('David of The White Rock') and Y Mochyn Du. We will also learn about the history of the harp in Wales.

Singing about a friend who was victim of inner-city violence, "TRAP PHONE" Carrying knives, and the song switches between slow-burning hip-hop and spoken word verses as BERWYN lets it all out in a poetic interlude: "when you go it leaves a hole in my soul / if they have a funeral for you / I can't promise I'll go / I don't cry in front of people / I only cry on my own".
Item.Billing: Kizzy Crawford and Huw Stephens present highlights from the 2021 Lleisiau Eraill (Other Voices) festival. This year, the festival had to move from its home in Cardigan to the National Museum in Cardiff. There was no audience but there was an eclectic feast of music from Ani Glass, The Gentle Good, Catrin Finch and Aoife Ni Bhriain, Juice Menace and Berwyn.

Item.Synopsis: Iolo Williams looks for town wildlife. This time, Iolo finds thousands of birds flying to town to spend the night. On Cardiff's busiest street, wagtails are keeping warm above shoppers. A huge flock of jackdaws assemble at the end of the day on a Llanelli industrial estate. There's an amazing aerial display by starlings around Aberystwyth pier. Iolo also finds thrushes and waxwings, beautiful birds from Scandinavia, flying to supermarkets in Llansamlet and Caernarfon to eat berries.

Iolo also finds thrushes and waxwings, beautiful birds from Scandinavia, flying to supermarkets in Llansamlet and Caernarfon to eat berries.

Item.Title: Welsh Whisperer: Ni'n Teithio Nawr
Item.Synopsis: A series of programmes following the Welsh Whisperer on his journey through rural villages of Wales meeting characters of whom are integral to their local communities keeping village life alive. This week he travel's to Carmarthenshire's largest village - Pontyberem in the company of local bard Aneirin Karadog who tells us about village life and the true meaning behind the village's name. Local tarmacadam boys get the chance to meet their idol and requests a special favour of the Welsh Whisperer
Item.Billing: A series of programmes following the Welsh Whisperer on his journey through rural villages in Wales, meeting characters who are integral to their local communities. Item.Title: Noson Lawen
Item.Synopsis: Ifan Jones Evans introduces a Noson Lawen featuring artists from the north of Ceredigion. There is a family theme going on in tonight's programme as Ifan welcomes his big brother, the tenor Robyn Lyn Evans and his wife Aneira to perform on the show along with the middle brother in the Evans family, Dewi Sion, who sings a well-known and very popular duet with his friend Barry Powell. Sian James, Meinir Gwilym, Gwyneth Glyn and Gwenan Gibbard are well known faces as soloists on the Noson Lawen, but tonight they morph as the new group 'Pedair'. With a successful career in musical theatre, Sam Ebenezer returns home from London to perform and the Welsh Whisperer delights the audience with his quirky performance. Musician Rhys Taylor, local talent Steffan Rees and students from Pantycelyn fill the stage and the theatre with stunning performances.

Item.Title: Oli Wyn
Item.Synopsis: Oli Wyn is a playful and curious cat who's wildly wacky about vehicles of all sorts. He loves to watch from his special signal box and loves it when his friends - the Cyw viewers - join him to see the various vehicles at work - from a JCB to a steam train, fire engine to a recycling bin! The Vale of Rheidol's steam train is about to venture out on its first journey following the winter. Today, the steam train crew are going to show us how they prepare the train for a trip on the tracks.

Item.Title: 24 Awr
Item.Genre: IP Ffeithiol/Adloniant Cyffredinol - Factual/Gen Ent Factual Entertainment
Item.Synopsis:
This series, will feature people going through a significant 24 hours in their life.
In this episode, we'll meet Gwyneth Longworth who is hoping to get her self=confidence back, following a series of difficulty events in her life.
Family is Gwyneth's world, and as a grandmother and mother, she embraces the chance to fill her home with her loved ones. But three years ago, Gwyneth had a blow, she fell ill, she had cancer, and also suffered from two strokes.
This took its toll on more than just Gwyneth's health. The pressure and stress caused her to lose her eyebrows, and also her confidence.
This is an important 24 hours in Gwyneth's life - as she embarks on having tattoos on her face, in the hope to restore her eyebrows and her self belief.
